results.title: Upwork: Python Developer for API & Web Scraping Tutorial Content
results.description:
We‚Äôre looking for Python developers with experience in web scraping, REST APIs, and basic data extraction to help us create short, simple technical tutorials. These could be code snippets, step-by-step guides, or screen-recorded demos (no voice required).

The tasks are straightforward ‚Äî ideal for someone who enjoys writing clean, well-documented code and breaking down concepts for others. This role is content-focused, not full software development.

What you‚Äôll do:
‚Ä¢ Create small Python scripts for scraping or API use cases
‚Ä¢ Document them clearly or record a short tutorial (screen-record only, no audio needed)
‚Ä¢ Follow an example format we‚Äôll provide

Ideal Skills:
‚Ä¢ Python (requests, BeautifulSoup, Selenium, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Experience with REST APIs (e.g. YouTube, Reddit, Rightmove, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Data formatting (JSON, CSV)
‚Ä¢ Clear written or visual communication

Scope & Budget:
‚Ä¢ Fixed-price tasks
‚Ä¢ Paid per completed content/tutorial
‚Ä¢ Potential for ongoing work and increased rates based on consistency and quality

To Apply:

‚Ä¢ Whether you‚Äôre comfortable creating screen-recorded tutorials (no voice needed)

results.title: Guru: Concept Airport Baggage Claim Animation
results.description:
Posted on Apr 22, 2025 | Job ID: 2104873
No results found
¬† Send before: May 25, 2025
Why can't I apply?

 Design & Art  Animation (2D / 3D / Traditional / Motion)
Create a realistic 3D animation or AI video of an airport baggage claim area where passengers stand around a baggage carousel.
There is a display above the baggage carousel stretching along it. the display is like a stock ticker display.
As each piece of baggage comes into view, a computer system detects the baggage barcode at a location just past the carousel entrance and displays the related seat number above the baggage. The seat numbers move in sync with the carousel, tracking the baggage as they move along the carousel.
Passengers watch the display for their seat numbers. When they spot their seat number, they step forward the carousel and grab the baggage under their seat number. In the next round, the computer system does not see the picked up baggage and does not display their seat numbers.
The attachments describe
